FinQwerty None (stock layout)
FinQwerty
You can configure your physical keyboard layout in the \"Language & input\" section of Android Settings, by selecting the first item under the \"Physical keyboard\" heading there.
Language & input settings
You can configure your physical keyboard layout corresponding to each virtual keyboard in the Physical keyboard section of Android settings.
Physical keyboard settings
Open the physical keyboard layout configuration dialog:
Configure %s layout
Configure %1$s layout when virtual keyboard \"%2$s\" is selected
No physical keyboards were found. If you are using a Moto Mod keyboard, open the slider now to allow layout setup.
Note that FinQwerty does not work on Android 8 Oreo on BlackBerry phones!
https://android.onse.fi/finqwerty/keyone_oreo
More information

In most cases you can also change your physical keyboard layout via Android Settings in Language & input => Physical keyboard. If you use that method and want to hide FinQwerty from the application launcher, press the below button:
If you want to hide FinQwerty from the application launcher, press the below button:
Hide FinQwerty from launcher
This screen will close and FinQwerty is removed from the launcher (a reboot may be required for the removal to take effect). This screen can be reached again by removing and reinstalling FinQwerty.
BlackBerry QWERTY keypad
BlackBerry AZERTY keypad
BlackBerry QWERTZ keypad

On the \"Choose keyboard layout\" dialog, press \"Setup keyboard layouts\" to open the full list of layouts. Select the FinQwerty layout appropriate for your device (FinQwerty layouts begin with \"FinQwerty\" in the alphabetical layout list) and then press the back button. Then select the FinQwerty layout you just added on the list.
The FinQwerty layouts begin with \"FinQwerty\" in the alphabetical layout list.
Charts and more

FinQwerty provides several physical keyboard layouts for easier access to local characters. See below for instructions on how to configure your phone to use a FinQwerty keyboard layout. Detailed charts of the provided keymaps are provided on the FinQwerty website.

Note that if you have the BlackBerry Keyboard software keyboard enabled with a non-English software layout, the physical keyboard layout may be reset frequently. To avoid that, configure the software keyboard to use the English (US) layout via Settings => Language & input => BlackBerry Keyboard Settings => Input languages => English (United States) (and deselect all the other languages).

Note that BlackBerry resets the keyboard layout to the original default on every boot. You will need to re-enable FinQwerty after every time the phone is restarted. Enable the below option to show a reconfiguration shortcut notification whenever the phone has been restarted so that you do not need to manually navigate to this app every time:
Show a configuration shortcut notification when the phone has been restarted
Key layout re-setup required
Touch to open layout setup.
